column2: Salt the fish and dip in equal parts of flour and corn-meal, thoroughly mixed.
column3: Salt the fish and dip in equal parts of flour and corn meal, thoroughly mixed.

column2: FRIED BROOK-TROUT
column3: FRIED BROOK TROUT

column2: Remove the fillets from slices of sea-trout, dip in beaten egg, then in seasoned crumbs, and fry in deep fat.
column3: Remove the fillets from slices of sea trout, dip in beaten egg, then in seasoned crumbs, and fry in deep fat.

column2: Serve with Tartar Sauce.
column3: Serve with Tartar Sauce.

column2: Boil and cool a trout and divide into fillets, removing the bone. Season with lemon-juice, chopped onion, and minced parsley, and cover with a very thick Cream Sauce.
column3: Boil and cool a trout and divide into fillets, removing the bone. Season with lemon juice, chopped onion, and minced parsley, and cover with a very thick Cream Sauce.

column2: Dip into crumbs, then into beaten egg, then into crumbs, fry in deep fat, and serve with any preferred sauce.
column3: Dip into crumbs, then into beaten egg, then into crumbs, fry in deep fat, and serve with any preferred sauce.

column2: FRIED TROUT WITH MUSHROOM SAUCE
column3: FRIED TROUT WITH MUSHROOM SAUCE

column2: TROUT WITH REMOULADE SAUCE
column3: TROUT WITH REMOULADE SAUCE

column2: Saute a small trout in butter, drain on brown paper, and serve with Remoulade Sauce.
column3: Saute a small trout in butter, drain on brown paper, and serve with Remoulade Sauce.

column2: FILLETS OF TROUT A L'AURORE
column3: FILLETS OF TROUT A L'AURORE

column2: Saute the fillets of a cleaned trout in butter, seasoning with salt and pepper.
column3: Saute the fillets of a cleaned trout in butter, seasoning with salt and pepper.

column2: Scrape and clean the trout, stuff with seasoned crumbs, and put into a buttered baking-dish.
column3: Scrape and clean the trout, stuff with seasoned crumbs, and put into a buttered baking dish.

column2: Bake, basting frequently.
column3: Bake, basting frequently.

column2: Thicken the liquid with butter and flour cooked together, pour over the fish, and serve.
column3: Thicken the liquid with butter and flour cooked together, pour over the fish, and serve.

column2: Clean a large sea or lake trout.
column3: Clean a large sea or lake trout.

column2: Cook the stuffing for ten minutes, using as little water as possible.
column3: Cook the stuffing for ten minutes, using as little water as possible.

column2: Stuff the fish, put into a buttered baking-pan with enough hot water to keep from burning.
column3: Stuff the fish, put into a buttered baking pan with enough hot water to keep from burning.

column2: Cover the fish with thin slices of salt pork and bake until done, adding more hot water if required.
column3: Cover the fish with thin slices of salt pork and bake until done, adding more hot water if required.

column2: Season with salt and pepper, add a few capers, pour around the fish, and serve.
column3: Season with salt and pepper, add a few capers, pour around the fish, and serve.

column2: Stuff a large sea or lake trout with mashed potatoes, seasoning with butter, pepper, salt, and grated onion.
column3: Stuff a large sea or lake trout with mashed potatoes, seasoning with butter, pepper, salt, and grated onion.

column2: Butter a baking-pan and cover the bottom with thin slices of tomatoes.
column3: Butter a baking pan and cover the bottom with thin slices of tomatoes.

column2: Lay the fish upon it, sprinkle with salt and pepper, add two tablespoonfuls of butter and enough water to keep from burning.
column3: Lay the fish upon it, sprinkle with salt and pepper, add two tablespoonfuls of butter and enough water to keep from burning.

column2: Bake until done and serve with the tomatoes and sliced hard-boiled eggs.
column3: Bake until done and serve with the tomatoes and sliced hard boiled eggs.

column2: Clean and score small trout, dip in seasoned melted butter, and put in a buttered baking-pan.
column3: Clean and score small trout, dip in seasoned melted butter, and put in a buttered baking pan.

column2: Serve with any preferred sauce.
column3: Serve with any preferred sauce.

column2: Put in a buttered baking-pan, sprinkle with minced parsley, and pour over half a cupful of stock to which two tablespoonfuls of butter have been added.
column3: Put in a buttered baking pan, sprinkle with minced parsley, and pour over half a cupful of stock to which two tablespoonfuls of butter have been added.

column2: Bake for half an hour, basting as required.
column3: Bake for half an hour, basting as required.

column2: Soak a cupful of bread-crumbs in milk, squeeze dry, add two tablespoonfuls of butter, the yolk of an egg, and pepper, salt, thyme, and lemon-juice to season.
column3: Soak a cupful of bread crumbs in milk, squeeze dry, add two tablespoonfuls of butter, the yolk of an egg, and pepper, salt, thyme, and lemon juice to season.

column2: Stuff the fish, sew up, put in a buttered baking-pan, dredge with flour, dot with butter, and bake.
column3: Stuff the fish, sew up, put in a buttered baking pan, dredge with flour, dot with butter, and bake.

column2: Cover with buttered paper and bake, basting with the liquid.
column3: Cover with buttered paper and bake, basting with the liquid.

column2: Take the fillets from a three-pound trout and bake for ten minutes in a buttered baking-pan.
column3: Take the fillets from a three pound trout and bake for ten minutes in a buttered baking pan.

column2: Cook until thick, stirring constantly, and add two tablespoonfuls of butter, broken into bits.
column3: Cook until thick, stirring constantly, and add two tablespoonfuls of butter, broken into bits.

column2: Pour the sauce over the fillets and bake for fifteen minutes longer.
column3: Pour the sauce over the fillets and bake for fifteen minutes longer.

column2: Split and bone the cleaned fish and put in a buttered baking-pan skin side down.
column3: Split and bone the cleaned fish and put in a buttered baking pan skin side down.

column2: Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and crumbs, and put into the oven.
column3: Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and crumbs, and put into the oven.

column2: Cover the bones and trimmings with cold water, adding two tablespoonfuls of butter, a sliced onion, and two cupfuls of stock. Boil for half an hour, strain, add a can of mushrooms, chopped, and enough crumbs to thicken.
column3: Cover the bones and trimmings with cold water, adding two tablespoonfuls of butter, a sliced onion, and two cupfuls of stock. Boil for half an hour, strain, add a can of mushrooms, chopped, and enough crumbs to thicken.

column2: Season with salt, pepper, and anchovy paste.
column3: Season with salt, pepper, and anchovy paste.

column2: Put half a dozen cleaned trout in a buttered baking-dish with half a glassful of white wine, and a finely chopped shallot.
column3: Put half a dozen cleaned trout in a buttered baking dish with half a glassful of white wine, and a finely chopped shallot.

column2: Add also a small chopped onion, two shallots, twice the quantity of mushrooms, and a bean of garlic, all minced and fried in butter.
column3: Add also a small chopped onion, two shallots, twice the quantity of mushrooms, and a bean of garlic, all minced and fried in butter.

column2: Season with salt, pepper, minced parsley, and lemon-juice; pour over the fish and serve.
column3: Season with salt, pepper, minced parsley, and lemon juice; pour over the fish and serve.

column2: BAKED TROUT WITH MUSHROOM SAUCE
column3: BAKED TROUT WITH MUSHROOM SAUCE

column2: Butter a baking-dish, sprinkle with bread-crumbs, lay a sea-trout upon it, cover with crumbs, dot with butter, squeeze over the juice of half a lemon, and bake, adding enough water to keep from burning. Brown a tablespoonful of flour in butter, add the liquid drained from the fish, one cupful each of mushroom and oyster liquor, and a wineglassful of Madeira.
column3: Butter a baking dish, sprinkle with bread crumbs, lay a sea trout upon it, cover with crumbs, dot with butter, squeeze over the juice of half a lemon, and bake, adding enough water to keep from burning. Brown a tablespoonful of flour in butter, add the liquid drained from the fish, one cupful each of mushroom and oyster liquor, and a wineglassful of Madeira.

column2: Cook until thick, stirring constantly, take from the fire, and add a few cooked oysters, shrimps, and mushrooms.
column3: Cook until thick, stirring constantly, take from the fire, and add a few cooked oysters, shrimps, and mushrooms.

column2: Season with salt and pepper and serve separately.
column3: Season with salt and pepper and serve separately.

column2: BAKED TROUT WITH POLISH SAUCE
column3: BAKED TROUT WITH POLISH SAUCE

column2: Sprinkle with crumbs, dot with butter, and bake slowly until done.
column3: Sprinkle with crumbs, dot with butter, and bake slowly until done.

column2: Melt one and one-half cupfuls of butter and add a tablespoonful of minced parsley, and three hard-boiled eggs chopped very fine.
column3: Melt one and one half cupfuls of butter and add a tablespoonful of minced parsley, and three hard boiled eggs chopped very fine.

column2: Serve the sauce separately.
column3: Serve the sauce separately.

column2: STUFFED TROUT
column3: STUFFED TROUT

column2: Put in a buttered baking-dish, lay in the fish, season with salt and pepper, cover with crumbs, dot with butter, pour over a little white wine, and bake in the oven.
column3: Put in a buttered baking dish, lay in the fish, season with salt and pepper, cover with crumbs, dot with butter, pour over a little white wine, and bake in the oven.

column2: Serve in the dish in which they were baked.
column3: Serve in the dish in which they were baked.

column2: Stuff trout with seasoned crumbs, cover each one with a thin slice of salt pork, and wrap in buttered paper, fastening the papers securely; bake and serve in the papers.
column3: Stuff trout with seasoned crumbs, cover each one with a thin slice of salt pork, and wrap in buttered paper, fastening the papers securely; bake and serve in the papers.

column2: Lay a very thin slice of salt pork on each fish and wrap in buttered paper.
column3: Lay a very thin slice of salt pork on each fish and wrap in buttered paper.

column2: Bake in a hot oven.
column3: Bake in a hot oven.

column2: Remove the string and serve in the paper.
column3: Remove the string and serve in the paper.

column2: TROUT IN CASES
column3: TROUT IN CASES

column2: Clean, parboil, and trim the fish, wrap in buttered paper, bake, and serve with Fine Herb Sauce.
column3: Clean, parboil, and trim the fish, wrap in buttered paper, bake, and serve with Fine Herb Sauce.

column2: Boil and skin the fish, put on a serving-dish, cover with Allemande Sauce, and the chopped yolks of hard-boiled eggs.
column3: Boil and skin the fish, put on a serving dish, cover with Allemande Sauce, and the chopped yolks of hard boiled eggs.

column2: Brown in the oven and serve with Aurora Sauce.
column3: Brown in the oven and serve with Aurora Sauce.

column2: Prepare six trout according to directions given in the recipe for Trout with Shrimp Sauce.
column3: Prepare six trout according to directions given in the recipe for Trout with Shrimp Sauce.

column2: Serve with one cupful of Spanish Sauce, adding two chopped truffles, half a dozen chopped mushrooms, a dozen chopped olives, and three tablespoonfuls of stewed and strained tomato.
column3: Serve with one cupful of Spanish Sauce, adding two chopped truffles, half a dozen chopped mushrooms, a dozen chopped olives, and three tablespoonfuls of stewed and strained tomato.

column2: Pour over the fish and serve.
column3: Pour over the fish and serve.

column2: Stuff cleaned trout with chopped oysters or seasoned crumbs, and put into a buttered baking-dish.
column3: Stuff cleaned trout with chopped oysters or seasoned crumbs, and put into a buttered baking dish.

column2: Add half a wineglassful of white wine, a sprig of celery, a bay-leaf, a sprig of thyme, two cloves, and salt and pepper to season.
column3: Add half a wineglassful of white wine, a sprig of celery, a bay leaf, a sprig of thyme, two cloves, and salt and pepper to season.

column2: Bake in the oven, basting frequently. Take up the fish, strain the liquid, and add it to a cupful of Spanish Sauce, with a chopped truffle, four cooked mushrooms, chopped, and a dozen cooked oysters.
column3: Bake in the oven, basting frequently. Take up the fish, strain the liquid, and add it to a cupful of Spanish Sauce, with a chopped truffle, four cooked mushrooms, chopped, and a dozen cooked oysters.

column2: Pour the sauce over the fish and serve.
column3: Pour the sauce over the fish and serve.

column2: Boil, skin, trim the fish, cover with very thick Cream Sauce and let cool.
column3: Boil, skin, trim the fish, cover with very thick Cream Sauce and let cool.

column2: Broil carefully.
column3: Broil carefully.

column2: Pour over the fish and serve.
column3: Pour over the fish and serve.

column2: Stuff a cleaned trout through the mouth with butter mixed with finely chopped sweet herbs.
column3: Stuff a cleaned trout through the mouth with butter mixed with finely chopped sweet herbs.

column2: Boil a large sea-trout in salted water, drain, skin, and serve with Italian Sauce, seasoned with butter, anchovy paste, nutmeg, and lemon-juice.
column3: Boil a large sea trout in salted water, drain, skin, and serve with Italian Sauce, seasoned with butter, anchovy paste, nutmeg, and lemon juice.

column2: Strain over the fish, garnish with olives, and serve.
column3: Strain over the fish, garnish with olives, and serve.

column2: Stuff a large trout with seasoned crumbs, and cover it with Claret, adding mushrooms, parsley, chopped onion, thyme, a bay-leaf, pepper-corns, and mace to season.
column3: Stuff a large trout with seasoned crumbs, and cover it with Claret, adding mushrooms, parsley, chopped onion, thyme, a bay leaf, pepper corns, and mace to season.

column2: Drain the fish and reduce the liquid by rapid boiling to one cupful.
column3: Drain the fish and reduce the liquid by rapid boiling to one cupful.
